info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 05 at 7:08PM CDT until August 05 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR WESTERN NORTON...NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN...SOUTHERN DECATUR AND NORTHWESTERN GRAHAM COUNTIES... At 708 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dresden, or 13 miles southeast of Oberlin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lenora, Norcatur, Jennings, Clayton, Dresden, Leoville and New Almelo. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
